From the HP Website, http://h20229.www2.hp.com/partner/isv/Arsin_prod1.jsp
=

I found that Effecta Integration Framework by Arsin Corporation may be use=
d for JUNIT integration. 

Unfortunaly, I am not able to find any documenta=
tion which tells me how to achieve this?

Any pointers? 

Regards
Gaurav Pa=
ndey
www.WhatIsTesting.com

<gaurav_dell@...> wrote:
>
> Hi

nce with JUnit however, I think I know my way around HPQC. 
>

owever as a process, I have been asked to find out if JUnit and HPQC are co=
mpatible.

ctices which would assist me in understanding the compatibility. 
>

so have some questions which I was not able to figure out?

ttp://www.junit.org/, however I have not been able to "load" the tool. I am=
